title: Is the Dakota Access Pipeline Continuing Despite a Denied Easement?
subtitle: Shortly after the Army Corps of Engineers denied Energy Transfer Partners a Dakota Access Pipeline easement, rumors circulated claiming the company would continue construction and incur a daily fine.
author: Kim LaCapria
vclaim: Despite a decision that halted construction of the Dakota Access Pipeline (DAPL), Energy Transfer Partners continued to build it and accept a $50,000 daily fine.
